subject: Philosophy
title: The Prisoner's Dilemma
description: A fast breakdown of The Prisoner's Dilemma for builders.

hook.text: Two prisoners can cooperate or betray each other. Logic says betray. But both end up worse off.

buildup.text: Each prisoner gets a lighter sentence by betraying. But if both betray, they both get harsh sentences.

discovery.text: Individual rationality leads to collective disaster. What's best for each is worst for all.

twist.text: Repeated games change the answer. When players meet again, cooperation emerges because trust builds over time.

climax.text: The dilemma explains arms races, climate inaction, and workplace politics. It's everywhere.

punchline.text: Selfishness is logical. Cooperation is smarter.

quiz.question: What does the prisoner's dilemma show?
options: Individual rationality can lead to collectively worse outcomes
